title: Fang Stocks Facebook, Google Near Buy Points As Tech Titans Drive Post-Coronavirus Market Rally
summary:
Facebook stock and Google stock are seeing heavy usage, though ad spending is a concern.
Amazon stock and Facebook stock both have 98 ratings.
Apple stock, Amazon stock and Netflix stock are on IBD Leaderboard.
Facebook stock, Google stock and AAPL stock are on SwingTrader.
YOU MAY ALSO LIKE:Tesla In Focus After Musk's Tweets; 5 Stocks Near Buy PointsWhat To Do After Coronavirus Stock Market CrashBest Growth Stocks To Buy And WatchIs Amazon Stock A Buy Right Now?
text:
FANG stocks Facebook (FB) and Google-parent Alphabet (GOOGL) are nearing buy points, while Netflix (NFLX), Amazon (AMZN) and Apple (AAPL) are extended above buy ranges but could fall back into range or form new entry points.

X

The post-coronavirus stock market rally has been powerful, in large part thanks to big-cap techs such as Apple stock and the four FANG internet giants. Netflix stock and Amazon stock are obvious coronavirus plays. Facebook stock and Google stock are seeing heavy usage, though ad spending is a concern. Apple stock delivered a surprise EPS gain, despite its exposure to coronavirus supply and demand issues.

Top Stocks To Buy And Watch

One way to find the best stocks is to look at their IBD Composite Ratings. The Composite Rating compiles scores on key fundamental and technical metrics: earnings and sales growth, profit margins, return on equity and relative price performance.

Netflix stock is at the top with a perfect 99 out of 99 Composite Rating. Amazon stock and Facebook stock both have 98 ratings. Alphabet stock has a 95 rating and Apple stock has a 90 rating.

Investors should be focusing on stocks with a Composite Rating of 90 or higher but it isn't the only metric investors should keep track of.

Apple stock, Amazon stock and Netflix stock are on IBD Leaderboard. Facebook stock, Google stock and AAPL stock are on SwingTrader.

Join IBD experts as they analyze actionable stocks in the coronavirus stock market rally on IBD Live.

Facebook Stock

Facebook is the FANG stock closest to being actionable as it forms a cup base with a 224.30 entry point, according to MarketSmith analysis. The FB stock base is 39% deep. Largely that's above what investors should typically be after. But it's not unusual following the huge stock market crash. Facebook stock edged up 0.5% to 212.35 on Friday, climbing 5% for the week.

The relative strength line for Facebook stock is already at new highs. The RS line, the blue line in the charts below, compares a stock's price performance to the S&P 500.

On April 29, Facebook reported first-quarter earnings that were mostly in line with expectations. Monthly active users climbed 10% to 2.6 billion as the users logged on the social media site to stay connected amid the coronavirus pandemic.

But the company also warned that the increased user activity wouldn't protect it from the pullback it's seeing in online advertising revenue.

Google Stock

The next FANG stock closest to being actionable is Google, which is forming a cup base and closing in on a 1,530.84 buy point. Google stock had fallen 34% from its high on March 23 as fears rose over the Covid-19 outbreak. But the RS line for GOOGL stock hit a new high Friday.

Google stock rose 1.1% to 1,384.34 on Friday, also up 5% for the week.

The parent of Google reported mixed Q1 results last month as advertising revenue from the travel, auto and retail sectors fell. But YouTube revenue rose 33% to $4.038 billion, while Google Cloud revenue surged 52%.

Netflix Stock

Netflix stock is extended from either a 383.11 buy point or 393.62 entry. During the bear market, NFLX stock fell more than 26% from a 52-week high in early March.

The FANG stock reported mixed Q1 financial results but it added 15.77 million new subscribers, crushing the 8.2 million subscribers analysts expected. Users went wild for its "Tiger King" documentary series, making it the most-streamed show in America in April, according to data analytics firm Parrot Analytics. "Ozark," now in its third season, and the fantasy series "The Witcher" have also been popular binge watches.

The coronavirus pandemic has simply accelerated the existing trend toward video on demand and away from traditional pay TV, Pivotal Research Group analyst Jeffrey Wlodarczak said in a report.

Netflix stock pulled back after its Q1 results, falling back to the top of its base before reversing higher in bullish fashion. NFLX stock dipped 0.2% to 435.55 on Friday, up nearly 5%. Shares are in a mini-consolidation above the prior base. It's not enough yet to form a proper pattern. But a move above the 449.52 peak could offer another entry into Netflix stock.

Apple Stock

Apple stock hit an all-time high of 327.85 on Jan. 29, just before the coronavirus stock market correction. AAPL stock has broken out of a second-stage cup-with-handle base with a buy point of 288.35 and is now slightly extended. Apple stock could dip back into the buy zone or form another handle to offer a new entry point, but hasn't shown signs of that yet.

Apple stock rose 2.1% to 310.13 on Friday, capping a 7.3% weekly gain. The RS line for AAPL stock is at a new high.

Apple stock is No. 1 in IBD's Telecom-Consumer Products group.

The consumer electronics company reported better-than-expected fiscal Q2 results in April as demand for services and wearable devices rose. But iPhone revenue fell 6.7% as the coronavirus pandemic hit production and consumer demand for smartphones.

Analysts say the pandemic could also delay the release of the iPhone 12, Apple's first expected 5G phone, from its projected September launch to between October and early December.

Amazon Stock

Amazon stock broke out of a cup base on April 14 with a buy point of 2,186.05. AMZN stock is currently extended above buy range. Shares rose 0.5% to 2,379.61 on Friday, climbing 4.1% for the week after rebounding from their 21-day line. AMZN stock could offer a new entry if its clears its record high of 2,475. Like Netflix stock, Amazon's short consolidation is far too short to be a proper pattern.

On May 1, Amazon stock tumbled nearly 8% following earnings, after hitting a record high heading into results. Q1 revenue growth beat Wall Street expectations. But earnings fell short and profit guidance was light as the e-commerce giant spends $4 billion on coronavirus-related expenses, to keep customers and employees safe.

Orders are soaring as customers are forced to stay at home amid the Covid-19 crisis. Amazon said it recently completed previous plans to hire 100,000 workers and will hire an additional 75,000 workers to meet growing demand. Amazon Web Services also is seeing strong demand from the stay-at-home trend.

<li><a href="https://www.investors.com/category/news/" rel="category tag">News</a></li></ul> <h1 class="header1">
Facebook, Google Near Buy Points As Tech Titans Drive Post-Coronavirus Stock Market Rally	</h1>
<div class="featured-post-image-container"></div>
<div class="addtoany_share_save_container addtoany_content_top row">
<div class="share">
<div class="a2a_kit a2a_kit_size_25 addtoany_list" data-a2a-url="https://www.investors.com/news/fang-stocks-facebook-alphabet-top-stocks-near-buy-range-post-coronavirus-market/" <ul class="post-meta">
<li><span class="authors-links"><a href="https://www.investors.com/author/richg/" title="Posts by GILLIAN RICH" class="author url fn" rel="author">GILLIAN RICH</a></span></li>

<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p>FANG stocks <strong>Facebook</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=FB' target='_blank'>FB</a>) and Google-parent <strong>Alphabet</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=GOOGL' target='_blank'>GOOGL</a>) are nearing buy points, while <strong>Netflix</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NFLX' target='_blank'>NFLX</a>), <strong>Amazon</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AMZN' target='_blank'>AMZN</a>) and <strong>Apple</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL' target='_blank'>AAPL</a>) are extended above buy ranges but could fall back into range or form new entry points.</p>
<span>
<span style="width:50%;" class="video-player-container vms-left">
<span class="shortcode-video" vid-id="5692279" vid-dom-id="5692279-5ebb5ed054716" vid-top="false" vid-repeat="1" vid-width="50" vid-url="https://content.jwplatform.com/manifests/Ps5c3xSC.m3u8" data-captions="[{"name":"English","url":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/tracks\/LqF9zPBn.vtt"}]" vid-name="Analyzing Improving Market Conditions With A Follow-Through Day" vid-cat="Technical Analysis" vid-date="04/08/2020" vid-image="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Ps5c3xSC-640x360.jpg" vid-authors="ALISSA CORAM">
<span class="close-mini-vid">X</span>
<span id="shortcode-video-player-5692279-5ebb5ed054716" class="ready-to-load"></span>
</span>
</span>
</span><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Analyzing Improving Market Conditions With A Follow-Through Day","description":"Now that the market is back in rally mode, we're walking you through the technicals that IBD always looks at during market corrections that signal an improving investing environment.","thumbnailUrl":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/04\/Ps5c3xSC-640x360.jpg","contentUrl":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/manifests\/Ps5c3xSC.m3u8","uploadDate":"2020-04-08T05:55:06+0000","duration":"PT234.24S","author":"ALISSA CORAM","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Investor's Business Daily","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ibd-logo.png"},"url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com"},"keywords":""}</script>
<p>The post-coronavirus stock market rally has been powerful, in large part thanks to big-cap techs such as Apple stock and the four FANG internet giants. Netflix stock and Amazon stock are obvious coronavirus plays. Facebook stock and Google stock are seeing heavy usage, though ad spending is a concern. Apple stock delivered a surprise EPS gain, despite its exposure to coronavirus supply and demand issues.</p>
<h2>Top Stocks To Buy And Watch</h2>
<p>One way to find the best stocks is to look at their <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-research-growth-stocks/">IBD Composite Ratings</a>. The Composite Rating compiles scores on key fundamental and technical metrics: earnings and sales growth, profit margins, return on equity and relative price performance.</p>
<p>Netflix stock is at the top with a perfect 99 out of 99 Composite Rating. Amazon stock and Facebook stock both have 98 ratings. Alphabet stock has a 95 rating and Apple stock has a 90 rating.</p>
<p>Investors should be focusing on stocks with a Composite Rating of 90 or higher but it isn't the only metric investors should keep track of.</p>
<p>Apple stock, Amazon stock and Netflix stock are on <a href="https://leaderboard.investors.com/#/leaders/leadersnearabuypoint">IBD Leaderboard</a>. Facebook stock, Google stock and AAPL stock are on <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/swingtrader/?artProdLink=Swingtrader">SwingTrader</a>.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="https://shop.investors.com/offer/splashresponsive.aspx?id=IBD-Live&src=A00433A&refcode=pdsoc%7Cggl%7Cibdlive%7C2019%7C11%7Cibdlive%7Cna%7C985802&intcode=invstcntnartcls|cms|ibdlive|2019|11|ibdlive|na|682843"><strong>Join IBD experts as they analyze actionable stocks in the coronavirus stock market rally on IBD Live.</strong></a></p>
<hr />
<h2>Facebook Stock</h2>
<p>Facebook is the FANG stock closest to being actionable as it forms a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/investing-202-why-some-great-cup-bases-dont-form-a-handle/">cup base</a> with a 224.30 entry point, according to <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith">MarketSmith analysis</a>. The FB stock base is 39% deep. Largely that's above what investors should typically be after. But it's not unusual following the huge stock market crash. Facebook stock edged up 0.5% to 212.35 on Friday, climbing 5% for the week.</p>
<p>The <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/a-stock-breakout-specialty-tool-the-relative-strength-line/">relative strength line</a> for Facebook stock is already at new highs. The RS line, the blue line in the charts below, compares a stock's price performance to the S&P 500.</p>
<p>On April 29, Facebook reported <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/technology/facebook-stock-ad-outlook-quarterly-earnings-could-hit/">first-quarter earnings</a> that were mostly in line with expectations. Monthly active users climbed 10% to 2.6 billion as the users logged on the social media site to stay connected amid the coronavirus pandemic.</p>
<p>But the company also warned that the increased user activity wouldn't protect it from the pullback it's seeing in online advertising revenue.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=weekly&symbol=fb'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Google Stock</h2>
<p>The next FANG stock closest to being actionable is Google, which is forming a cup base and closing in on a 1,530.84 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/chart-reading-basics-how-a-buy-point-marks-a-time-of-opportunity/">buy point</a>. Google stock had fallen 34% from its high on March 23 as fears rose over the Covid-19 outbreak. But the RS line for GOOGL stock hit a new high Friday.</p>
<p>Google stock rose 1.1% to 1,384.34 on Friday, also up 5% for the week.</p>
<p>The parent of Google reported mixed Q1 results last month as advertising revenue from the travel, auto and retail sectors fell. But YouTube revenue rose 33% to $4.038 billion, while Google Cloud revenue surged 52%.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=weekly&symbol=GOOGL'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Netflix Stock</h2>
<p>Netflix stock is extended from either a 383.11 buy point or 393.62 entry. During the bear market, NFLX stock fell more than 26% from a 52-week high in early March.</p>
<p>The FANG stock reported mixed <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/technology/click/netflix-stock-first-quarter-earnings-report/">Q1 financial results</a> but it added 15.77 million new subscribers, crushing the 8.2 million subscribers analysts expected. Users went wild for its <a href="https://observer.com/2020/05/netflix-disney-plus-hulu-most-watched-series-quarantine-coronavirus-april/">"Tiger King" documentary series</a>, making it the most-streamed show in America in April, according to data analytics firm Parrot Analytics. "Ozark," now in its third season, and the fantasy series "The Witcher" have also been popular binge watches.</p>
<p>The coronavirus pandemic has simply accelerated the existing trend toward video on demand and away from traditional pay TV, Pivotal Research Group analyst Jeffrey Wlodarczak said in a report.</p>
<p>Netflix stock pulled back after its Q1 results, falling back to the top of its base before reversing higher in bullish fashion. NFLX stock dipped 0.2% to 435.55 on Friday, up nearly 5%. Shares are in a mini-consolidation above the prior base. It's not enough yet to form a proper pattern. But a move above the 449.52 peak could offer another entry into Netflix stock.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=weekly&symbol=NFLX'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Apple Stock</h2>
<p>Apple stock hit an all-time high of 327.85 on Jan. 29, just before the coronavirus stock market correction. AAPL stock has broken out of a second-stage <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-buy-stocks-cup-with-handle-base-alibaba-stock-buy-point/">cup-with-handle base</a> with a buy point of 288.35 and is now slightly extended. Apple stock could dip back into the buy zone or form another handle to offer a new entry point, but hasn't shown signs of that yet.</p>
<p>Apple stock rose 2.1% to 310.13 on Friday, capping a 7.3% weekly gain. The RS line for AAPL stock is at a new high.</p>
<p>Apple stock is No. 1 in IBD's Telecom-Consumer Products group.</p>
<p>The consumer electronics company reported better-than-expected fiscal Q2 results in April as demand for services and wearable devices rose. But iPhone revenue fell 6.7% as the coronavirus pandemic hit production and consumer demand for smartphones.</p>
<p>Analysts say the pandemic could also delay the release of the iPhone 12, Apple's first expected 5G phone, from its projected September launch to between October and early December.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=weekly&symbol=AAPL'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Amazon Stock</h2>
<p>Amazon stock broke out of a cup base on April 14 with a buy point of 2,186.05. AMZN stock is currently extended above buy range. Shares rose 0.5% to 2,379.61 on Friday, climbing 4.1% for the week after rebounding from their 21-day line. AMZN stock could offer a new entry if its clears its record high of 2,475. Like Netflix stock, Amazon's short consolidation is far too short to be a proper pattern.</p>
<p>On May 1, Amazon stock tumbled nearly 8% following earnings, after hitting a record high heading into results. <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/technology/amazon-stock-trading-quarterly-earnings-report/">Q1 revenue</a> growth beat Wall Street expectations. But earnings fell short and profit guidance was light as the e-commerce giant spends $4 billion on coronavirus-related expenses, to keep customers and employees safe.</p>
<p>Orders are soaring as customers are forced to stay at home amid the Covid-19 crisis. Amazon said it recently completed previous plans to hire 100,000 workers and will hire an additional 75,000 workers to meet growing demand. Amazon Web Services also is seeing strong demand from the stay-at-home trend.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=weekly&symbol=AMZN'></iframe></div></div>
